result.execSummary:
The defendant Avrian L Pride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Avrian L Pride is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Avrian L Pride was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

PROBATION REVIEW hearing December 18, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges.  Bail to apply.  Remaining costs and surcharges to be paid during probation.  If not paid, civil judgment to be entered.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.  Defendant may have third party contact for seeing the children.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program and parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Avrian L Pride

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Avrian L Pride in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Defendant admonished by the court for his attitude.
Based upon the defendant's somewhat compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $294.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/16/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 04/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
clerical error, sentencing Court Official only.

Defendant Avian Pride in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction as to count 1, with credit for -0- days served.  
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 15 months,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction as to count 1; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for seeing the child/ren.
- Maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges from the bail on deposit, remaining costs and surcharges to be paid during probation; if not paid,  civil judgment to be entered.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
If the defendant complies with all of the conditions of probation prior to the 15 months, the agent may request an earlier release.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Avrian L Pride in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial, however the defense would like to resolve the case with a plea.  
As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.
As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Avrian L Pride in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Avrian L Pride in court PRO SE. Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Benjamin T Van Severen, present in court to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month starting the 1st of each month after the end of the case, and each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Avrian L Pride in court.  Ann R. López appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-041

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/2/15 @ 1:30 pm
